sections.heading: What is Keigo?
sections.content:
Keigo (敬語) is the Japanese honorific language system used to show respect, humility, and politeness. It's essential for proper social communication in Japan, reflecting the hierarchical nature of Japanese society. Keigo adjusts language based on the relationship between speaker, listener, and the person being discussed.

Regular: 食べる "eat" Respectful: 召し上がる "eat" (respectful) Humble: いただく "eat" (humble) Polite: 食べます "eat" (polite)

children.heading: 尊敬語 (Sonkeigo) - Respectful Language
children.content: Purpose: Elevate others' actions Used for: Superiors, customers, elders 先生が来る → 先生がいらっしゃる "The teacher comes" → "The teacher comes" (respectful) Raises status of subject

children.heading: 謙譲語 (Kenjougo) - Humble Language
children.content: Purpose: Lower your own actions Used when: You do something for/to superior 私が行く → 私が参る "I go" → "I go" (humble) Lowers speaker's status

children.heading: 丁寧語 (Teineigo) - Polite Language
children.content: Purpose: Show general politeness Used for: Polite conversation 食べる → 食べます "eat" → "eat" (polite) です/ます form Basic politeness

children.heading: Social hierarchy
children.content: Higher status: - Bosses, teachers, customers - Elders, guests → Use Sonkeigo for their actions Lower status (self): - Employee, student, service staff - Younger person → Use Kenjougo for your actions Basic politeness: - Teineigo for general polite speech

children.heading: Regular vs Keigo
children.content: Regular: 言う "say" Respectful: おっしゃる "say" (for superior) Humble: 申す/申し上げる "say" (for self to superior) Polite: 言います "say" (general polite)

children.heading: In context
children.content: Casual: 先生、何か言った？ "Teacher, did you say something?" Keigo: 先生、何かおっしゃいましたか。 "Teacher, did you say something?" (respectful)

children.heading: Sonkeigo (Respectful)
children.content: Boss does action: 部長が読む → 部長がお読みになる "The director reads" (respectful) Customer does action: お客様が来る → お客様がいらっしゃる "The customer comes" (respectful)

children.heading: Kenjougo (Humble)
children.content: I do action for boss: 私が持つ → 私がお持ちします "I carry" → "I'll carry (for you)" (humble) I give to superior: あげる → 差し上げる "give" → "give (to superior)" (humble)

children.heading: Teineigo (Polite)
children.content: General polite speech: 行く → 行きます "go" → "go" (polite) 食べる → 食べます "eat" → "eat" (polite) Basic politeness layer

children.heading: Can layer keigo
children.content: Respectful + Polite: 先生がいらっしゃいました "The teacher came" (respectful + polite) Humble + Polite: 私が参ります "I will go" (humble + polite) Multiple layers common

children.heading: At work
children.content: Boss's action: Sonkeigo 部長がおっしゃいました "The director said" (respectful) Your action to boss: Kenjougo 私が申し上げました "I said (to superior)" (humble) General statement: Teineigo 会議は3時です "The meeting is at 3" (polite)

children.heading: Customer service
children.content: Customer's action: Sonkeigo お客様がお選びになりました "The customer chose" (respectful) Staff's action: Kenjougo 私がご案内いたします "I will guide (you)" (humble)

children.heading: Direction of respect
children.content: ↑ Sonkeigo: Elevate others Subject receives respect Their actions are elevated ↓ Kenjougo: Lower yourself Speaker lowers own actions Shows humility to superior → Teineigo: General politeness Neutral polite form

children.heading: Uchi (in-group) vs Soto (out-group)
children.content: Talking to outsider about your boss: 部長が言いました (not おっしゃいました) "My director said" (lower your side) Your company is "uchi" Lower your own group to outsiders

children.heading: Using wrong type
children.content: Wrong: 私がいらっしゃる ⚠️ (Respectful for self) Correct: 私が参る ✓ "I go" (humble) Match keigo type to person

children.heading: Over-keigo to peers
children.content: Unnatural: 友達がいらっしゃる ⚠️ Natural: 友達が来る ✓ "Friend comes" Don't over-keigo with friends

children.heading: Start with basics
children.content: 1. Learn Teineigo first (です/ます) 2. Learn common Sonkeigo verbs 3. Learn common Kenjougo verbs 4. Practice in context Gradual progression

children.heading: Social importance
children.content: Shows respect Maintains harmony Professional necessity Cultural understanding Essential for: - Business - Customer service - Formal situations - Daily politeness

children.heading: Essential respectful
children.content: いる → いらっしゃる "be/exist" 来る → いらっしゃる/お見えになる "come" 行く → いらっしゃる "go" 言う → おっしゃる "say" する → なさる "do" 見る → ご覧になる "see/look"

children.heading: Essential humble
children.content: いる → おる "be/exist" 行く → 参る "go" 来る → 参る "come" 言う → 申す/申し上げる "say" する → いたす "do" 見る → 拝見する "see/look"

children.heading: Basic
children.content: Regular: 先生が来る Keigo: 先生がいらっしゃる "The teacher comes" Regular: 私が読む Keigo: 私が読みます (polite) 私が拝読します (humble) "I read" Regular: 社長が言った Keigo: 社長がおっしゃいました "The president said"

children.heading: Intermediate
children.content: 先生がこの本をお読みになりました。 とても面白いとおっしゃっていました。 "The teacher read this book (respectful). He/She was saying it was very interesting (respectful)." 明日、私が部長のところへ参ります。 資料をお持ちいたします。 "Tomorrow, I will go to the director (humble). I will bring the documents (humble)." お客様がいらっしゃいました。 ご案内いたしますので、少々 お待ちください。 "The customer has arrived (respectful). I will guide you (humble), so please wait a moment (polite)."
